sen.j: 生駒山（いこまやま・いこまさん）は、奈良県生駒市と大阪府東大阪市との県境にある標高642mの山。
sen.e: Mt. Ikoma (Ikoma yama, Ikoma san) is 642 meters in height, and is located on the border between ikoma City, Nara Prefecture and Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Ikoma (Ikoma yama, Ikoma san) is 642 meters in height, and is located on the border between ikoma City, Nara Prefecture and Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Ikoma (Ikoma yama, Ikoma san) is 642 meters in height, and is located on the border between ikoma City, Nara Prefecture and Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 生駒山地の主峰である。
sen.e: It is the main peak of Ikoma Mountain Range.
It is the main peak of Ikoma Mountain Range.
It is the main peak of Ikoma Mountain Range.

sen.j: 山頂は奈良県側にある。
sen.e: The mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma is located on the Nara Prefecture side.
The mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma is located on the Nara Prefecture side.
The mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma is located on the Nara Prefecture side.

sen.j: 山上には生駒山上遊園地（スカイランドいこま）が開設されている。
sen.e: Skyland Ikoma (amusement park) is located on the mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma.
Skyland Ikoma (amusement park) is located on the mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma.
Skyland Ikoma (amusement park) is located on the mountaintop of Mt. Ikoma.

sen.j: 山上・中腹には、大阪府・奈良県にある各テレビ局の京阪神と奈良県をカバーする送信所（生駒山テレビ・FM送信所）が別々に設置されている。
sen.e: The transmission stations of a TV station in Osaka Prefecture, which covers the Keihanshin area, and of a TV station in Nara Prefecture, which covers Nara prefecture (Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station) are separately located on the mountaintop and at the half way up of the mountain.

The transmission stations of a TV station in Osaka Prefecture, which covers the Keihanshin area, and of a TV station in Nara Prefecture, which covers Nara prefecture (Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station) are separately located on the mountaintop and mountainside, respectively.
sen.cmt: at the half way up of the mountain --> mountainside, respectively
sen.e: The transmission stations of a TV station in Osaka Prefecture, which covers the Keihanshin area, and of a TV station in Nara Prefecture, which covers Nara prefecture (Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station) are separately located on the mountaintop and mountainside, respectively.

sen.j: 奈良県生駒市の近鉄奈良線生駒駅から、近鉄生駒鋼索線が通じている。
sen.e: The mountain can be accessed by Kintetsu Ikoma Kosaku Line from Ikoma Station, Kintetsu Nara Line in Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The mountain can be accessed by the Kintetsu Ikoma Kosaku Line starting from Ikoma Station of the Kintetsu Nara Line, in Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 電車路線名に定冠詞を付与、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: The mountain can be accessed by the Kintetsu Ikoma Kosaku Line starting from Ikoma Station of the Kintetsu Nara Line, in Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 信貴生駒スカイラインを利用すれば車で登ることができる。
sen.e: It can be accessed by car via Shigi-Ikoma Skyline.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It can be accessed by car via Shigi-Ikoma Skyline.
It can be accessed by car via Shigi-Ikoma Skyline.

sen.j: 登山道は、近鉄奈良線額田駅 (大阪府)、石切駅、生駒駅、近鉄けいはんな線新石切駅からのコースがある。
sen.e: There are several routes of the climb to Mt. Ikoma, from Nukata Station of Kintetsu Nara Line (Osaka Prefecture), Ishikiri Station, Ikoma Station, and Shin-Ishikiri Station of Kintetsu Keihanna Line.

There are several routes of the climb to Mt. Ikoma, from Nukata Station of the Kintetsu Nara Line (Osaka Prefecture), Ishikiri Station, Ikoma Station, and Shin-Ishikiri Station of the Kintetsu Keihanna Line.
sen.cmt: 電車路線名に定冠詞を付与、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: There are several routes of the climb to Mt. Ikoma, from Nukata Station of the Kintetsu Nara Line (Osaka Prefecture), Ishikiri Station, Ikoma Station, and Shin-Ishikiri Station of the Kintetsu Keihanna Line.

sen.j: 山腹には現世信仰で知られる宝山寺を中心として、滝の修行場や祠など大小さまざまな宗教団体の施設が設けられている。
sen.e: Facilities including sites for practicing cold water ablutions by a fall, or hokora (a small shrine) of large and small religious organizations centering on Hozan-ji Temple, which is known for belief in material benefits, are located on the mountain side.

Facilities including sites for practicing cold water ablutions by a fall (stand under a waterfall), or hokora (a small shrine) of large and small religious organizations centering on Hozan-ji Temple, which is known for belief in material benefits, are located on the mountainside.
sen.cmt: 説明(stand under a waterfall)の追加、mountain sideをmountainsideに変更
sen.e: Facilities including sites for practicing cold water ablutions by a fall (stand under a waterfall), or hokora (a small shrine) of large and small religious organizations centering on Hozan-ji Temple, which is known for belief in material benefits, are located on the mountainside.

sen.j: これらは宗教法人として届けられていないものも多く、その総数は把握されていない。
sen.e: Many of these were not reported as the facilities of religious organizations, and the number of those facilities are not grasped.
Many of these have not been reported as facilities of religious organizations, and the number of those facilities are not grasped.
sen.cmt: 時制(were not をhave not been に変更)、the facilities of religious organizationsからtheを削除
sen.e: Many of these have not been reported as facilities of religious organizations, and the number of those facilities are not grasped.

sen.j: 在日コリアンによるシャーマニズム信仰の場である朝鮮寺は生駒山西麓を中心に存在している。
sen.e: The Korean Temple, a site for shamanism by Koreans in Japan is mainly located on the western foot of Mt. Ikoma.
sen.cmt: 朝鮮寺は生駒山西麓を中心に存在している。→意味解釈がやや不明だったのですが原文のとおりに訳出しています。
sen.e: Korean Temple, a site for shamanism by Koreans in Japan is mainly located at the western foot of Mt. Ikoma.
sen.cmt: The Korean TempleからTheを削除、 on the western foot --> at the western foot
sen.e: Korean Temple, a site for shamanism by Koreans in Japan is mainly located at the western foot of Mt. Ikoma.

sen.j: 奈良県側の山麓に、生駒山の神を祀る往馬坐伊古麻都比古神社（往馬大社）がある。
sen.e: There is Ikomanimasuikomatsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Ikoma-taisha Shrine), where the God of Mt. Ikoma is worshipped, on the foot of Mt. Ikoma on Nara Prefecture side.
There is Ikomanimasuikomatsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Ikoma-taisha Shrine), where the God of Mt. Ikoma is worshipped, at the foot of Mt. Ikoma on the Nara Prefecture side.
sen.cmt: on the foot をat the footに変更、Nara Prefecture side に定冠詞を付与(-->the Nara Prefecture side)
sen.e: There is Ikomanimasuikomatsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Ikoma-taisha Shrine), where the God of Mt. Ikoma is worshipped, at the foot of Mt. Ikoma on the Nara Prefecture side.

sen.j: 近鉄奈良線新生駒トンネル、近鉄けいはんな線生駒トンネル、大阪電気軌道生駒トンネル奈良線生駒トンネル、及び第二阪奈有料道路阪奈トンネルが当山を東西に貫いている。
sen.e: Kintetsu Nara Line New Ikoma Tunnel, Kintetsu Keihanna Line Ikoma Tunnel, Osaka Electric Tramway Ikoma Tunnel, Nara Line Ikoma Tunnel, and Daini-Hanna Road Toll Hanna Tunnel go through the mountain from east to west.

Kintetsu Nara Line New Ikoma Tunnel, Kintetsu Keihanna Line Ikoma Tunnel, Osaka Electric Tramway Ikoma Tunnel, Nara Line Ikoma Tunnel, and Daini-Hanna Road Toll Hanna Tunnel go through the mountain from east to west.

Kintetsu Nara Line New Ikoma Tunnel, Kintetsu Keihanna Line Ikoma Tunnel, Osaka Electric Tramway Ikoma Tunnel, Nara Line Ikoma Tunnel, and Daini-Hanna Road Toll Hanna Tunnel go through the mountain from east to west.

sen.j: 生駒山テレビ・FM送信所を参照
sen.e: Refer to Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station
Refer to Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station
Refer to Mt. Ikoma TV FM Transmission Station
